line: The Southern War Poetry of
the Civil War
BY
ESTHER PARKER ELLINGER
Thesis presented to the Faculty of the Graduate School of the
University of Pennsylvania, May 1918, in partial fulfilment of
the requirements for the degree of Doctor of Philosophy
PHILADELPHIA, PA.
COPYRIGHT, 1918
ESTHER PARKER ELLINGER
THE HERSHEY PRESS
HERSHEY, PA.
FOREWORD
In the assembling of material so widely scattered and so long unsought
either by students or by collectors, it has been necessary for me
to depend in some measure on the efforts of others who have been
most generous with their help and assistance. I desire to record
my gratitude especially to my Father and my Mother, without whose
unfailing sympathy and co-operation this work could not have been done:
and to Mrs. C. Francis Osborne of Philadelphia, Miss Sallie Shepherd
of Norfolk, Virginia, and Miss Florence D. Johnston of Philadelphia,
for books and individual poems. For their courtesy in allowing me free
access to the collections committed to their charge I must acknowledge
further indebtedness to Mr. Wallace H. Cathcart, Vice-President and
Director of the Western Reserve Historical Society, Cleveland, whose
splendid collection of Civil War items contains many rare and important
imprints and broadsides: and to Mr. Bunford Samuel, of the Ridgway
Branch of the Library Company of Philadelphia, to whose private
collection I am indebted for several poems which I have not found
elsewhere.
Particularly to Dr. Arthur Hobson Quinn of the University of
Pennsylvania, under whose direction this thesis was written, I wish to
acknowledge my obligation and to express my sincere appreciation for
his guidance and advice.
E. P. E.
University of Pennsylvania, 15 April, 1918.
“Time in its deeps swims like a monstrous whale: and like a
whale, feeds on the littlest things--small tunes and little
unskilled songs of the olden golden evenings--and anon turneth
whale-like to overthrow whole ships.”
Dunsany--“The Raft Builders.”

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: “The emotional literature of a people,” wrote one of the greatest of

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: the Southern poets, William Gilmore Simms,[1] “is as necessary to the

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: philosophic historian as the mere detail of events in the progress of a

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: nation.... The mere facts in a history do not always or often indicate

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: the true _animus_ of the action. But in poetry and song the emotional

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: nature is apt to declare itself without reserve ... speaking out with

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: a passion which disdains subterfuge, and through media of imagination

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: and fancy, which are not only without reserve, but which are too

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: coercive in their own nature, too arbitrary in their own influence, to

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: acknowledge any restraint upon that expression which glows or weeps

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: with emotions that gush freshly and freely from the heart.”

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: Edmund Clarence Stedman[2] put the matter a little differently.

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: Asking what may constitute the significance of any body of rhythmical

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: literature, restricted to its own territory, he answered the question

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: thus: “Undoubtedly and first of all, the essential quality of its

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: material as poetry; next to this, its quality as an expression and

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: interpretation of the time itself. In many an era, the second factor

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: may afford a surer means of estimate than the first, inasmuch as the

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: purely literary result may be nothing rarer than the world already has

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: possessed, nor greatly differing from it: nevertheless it may be the

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: voice of a time, of a generation, of a people ... all of extraordinary

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: import to the world’s future.”

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: “Our own poetry,” he continues elsewhere,[3] “excels as a recognizable

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: voice in utterance of the emotions of a people. The storm and stress

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: of youth have been upon us, and the nation has not lacked its lyric

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: cry.... One who underrates the significance of our literature, prose

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: or verse, as both the expression and the stimulant of national feeling,

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: as of import in the past and to the future of America, is deficient in

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: that critical insight which can judge even of its own day unwarped by

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: personal taste or deference to public impression. He shuts his eyes to

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: the fact that at times, notably throughout the years resulting in the

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: Civil War, this literature has been a ‘force.’”

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: That the poetry written in the Confederate States during the days of

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: the Civil War was a “force” in potency second only to the army in the

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: field, is a fact that has been too long unnoticed by commentators on

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: the literature of our country. In the rare cases when its influence was

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: recognized, its quality has been mistaken, its character misunderstood,

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: its quantity and volume under-estimated. Due perhaps in part to the

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: intensity of feeling engendered between victors and vanquished in

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: the Lost Cause, the darkness of the days following the close of the

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: war effectively hid from view and kept from national circulation the

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: verses and songs which the war had produced in the South. This was the

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: primary cause which prevented them from attaining the universal and

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: critical appreciation of their value that was the right of so large

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: and important a movement in the history of American letters. The ruin

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: of the South financially and economically, prevented her from calling

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: attention to her own achievement: while the widespread destruction and

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: dispersal of property, as well as the necessarily ephemeral nature of

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: many of her publications, offers not the least satisfactory explanation

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: for the comparative restriction of Southern Civil War verse to the land

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: whence it sprang.

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: If, however, to the modern critic these poems and songs are

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: comparatively unknown, by the Southerner of Civil War days their value

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: was understood and appreciated to the full. Within a year after war

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: broke out, early in the days of ’62, at least two definite attempts to

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: assemble the fast multiplying verses and songs were being made, the

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: first[4] by Professor Chase and John R. Thompson of Richmond, editor of

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: the _Southern Field and Fireside_; the second by “Bohemian,” Mr. W. G.

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: Shepperson, who was a correspondent for the Richmond _Despatch_. The

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: latter effort resulted, in the spring of ’62, in a volume of “War Songs

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: of the South,” containing some one hundred and eight poems, and with

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: the following significant words in the Preface:

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: “Written contemporaneously with the achievements which they celebrate,

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: [these poems] possess all the vitality and force of the testimony

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: of eye-witnesses to a glorious combat, or even of actors in it. The

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: spontaneous outburst of popular feeling, they give the lie to the

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: assertion of our enemy that this revolution is the work of politicians

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: and party leaders alone.

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: “Through the Poets’ Corner in the newspaper, they have sped their

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: flight from and to the heart and mind of the people. They showed which

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: way the wind was blowing when the war arose ‘a little cloud like a

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: man’s hand,’ and black as the heavens may now appear, they bravely sing

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: above the storm, soaring so high that their wings are brightened by the

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: sun behind the clouds.

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: “They cannot fail to challenge the attention of the philosophic

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: historian by their origin, and their influence.... In every age,

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: martial songs have wrought wonders in struggles for national

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: independence.

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: “And surely these newspaper waifs have played no unimportant part in

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: the actual drama which surrounds us....

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: “A single volume of ordinary size cannot contain a tithe of the songs

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: which have already appeared, and are daily appearing. This, however,

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: offers enough to show that during the present eventful period, what

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: was said of the early Spaniard is true of the Southron: ‘He has been

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: unconsciously surrounding history with the light of imagination,

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: linking great names with great deeds, concentrating those universal

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: recollections in which everyone feels he has a part, and silently

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: building up the fabric of national poetry on the basis of national

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: enthusiasm.’”

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: Fifty years later another Southerner, William Malone Baskerville,[5]

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: wrote this: “A young Marylander, a stripling just from college, was

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: dreaming dreams from which he was awakened by the guns of Sumter. One

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: sleepless night in April, 1861, he wrote the poem, ‘My Maryland,’ which

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: may not inaptly be called the first note of the new Southern literature

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: ... ‘new in strength, new in depth, new in the largest elements of

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: beauty and truth.’ He that had ears to hear might have heard in the

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: booming of those guns not only the signal for a gigantic contest, but

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: also the proclamation of the passing away of the old order, and along

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: with it the waxflowery, amateurish and sentimental race of Southern

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: writers.” The passing of this school, of course, meant the passing

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: of what usually has been recognized as the typical literary mode of

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: the South. It meant, however, much more than this: for the changing

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: order was made possible only by the passing of the particular type of

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: civilization that had fostered it, and this, in its turn indicated a

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: complete and thorough renaissance not only of life and letters, but

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: also of Southern soul and spirit.

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: The type of civilization that endured in the South, to the days of the

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: Civil War, was one of the most picturesque periods of society that can

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: be imagined, but not one that induced or encouraged serious literature.

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: In the North, on the other hand, where there were to be found many

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: large cities as centres of population, and the great national colleges,

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: literature had developed with the people. The earliest settlers of

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: New England had been of a religious, thoughtful, and philosophical

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: disposition, and their manners and mode of life had served to

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: strengthen these tendencies in their descendants. Even the climate

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: of the country had a marked influence in emphasizing New England’s

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: bent towards literature. Rigorous winters and inclement temperatures

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: led to long enforced periods of indoor life, conducive to study and

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: reflection. The effort and stress required to wring a living from

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: the stubborn soil made them an active and a vigorous people. At the

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: same time the comparatively small size of their territory, the number

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: of their towns and cities and the ease of travel over the hard and

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: rocky roads brought them much in contact with each other, and insured

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: communication of thought. Theirs was a civilization founded on civil

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: ties. Farms were small, cultivated usually by the family of the owners,

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: with a few “hired help,” and centered about the smaller villages and

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: townships, which in their turn were satellites of the towns. The

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: towns, again, clustered around the cities, which were thus as hubs in

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: the wheels of society. The rising individual graduated from the town

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: to the city, where were gathered the leading spirits and forces of

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: the day. From the cities back to the smaller communities returned the

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: great newspapers and magazines, whose spiritual and mental authority

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: went unchallenged, and which served the more to amalgamate into a

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: living thoughtful whole the inhabitants of the farthest corner of the

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: countryside. For everyone life was hard and plain; and there followed

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: the accepted corollary of high and resolute thought.

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: In the South, the thought unquestionably was as grave and lofty. It

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: was, however, neither in the hands of the people, as a whole, nor so

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: thoroughly co-ordinated into an entity. This lack of centralization

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: and unity arose from the very order of society, and was at once its

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: destruction, its charm, and its misfortune. In the first place, as

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: regards its territory in comparison with the North, there were few

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: large cities, and these were far apart. From Richmond to Charleston

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: and New Orleans as the crow flies is nearly three times the distance

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: from Boston to Philadelphia. In the days of postillions, and in the

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: later days of steamboats and railroads, a warm damp climate made travel

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: tedious and tiresome. Neither did the large cities occupy the positions

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: of importance of their Northern rivals. Because of the fertile soil,

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: fair climate and multiplicity of laborers the financial and political

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: power of the country was to be found quite as often among the owners

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: of the great plantations, as in the counting rooms or law offices of

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: the metropolis. For various reasons, there were no great and powerful

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: publishing houses, or influential magazines in general circulation,

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: the newspaper taking these places. Another factor there was also,

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: that was especially disintegrating for society at large. Before the

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: war, education in the South was not universal. For about half the

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: population, the women were educated at home, or in the case of the

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: well-to-do, at seminaries and boarding schools. The men, as in the old

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: Colonial days, had their private tutors, and were then sent to the

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: Universities at home or abroad, and to travel. But for the mass of

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: the poorer people, there was little to be had beyond the rudiments of

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: training: and for many years the University of Virginia was the only

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: educational institution below the line, which was the academic equal of

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: the Northern colleges. Education here, as everywhere in the South, was

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: along purely classic lines, which trained the people to find authority

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: in the past, and which tended to create a lack of sympathy with

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: problems other than those immediately concerning the public polity.

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: Hence it was that the intellectual relationships of the North were

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: exchanged in the South for social ties; which proved in times of stress

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: more powerful and unifying than those beyond the Line, and which made

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: possible, later on, the sympathetic consolidation and confederacy of

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: the States at the first minute of invasion. In that instant, they were

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: “a band of brothers,” in a common fellowship and interest: and thus it

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: was that the very conditions militating against their literature and

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: literary progress before the War, became in 1861, at once their allies

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: in the field, and on Parnassus.

line: authors may only be described as unreal and utterly false in tone

line: and color. It is sensational to a degree, but its popularity was in

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: proportion to its lack of artistic conception. Further than this, what

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: was true of her prose, was true of her verse. Just as the fiction of

line: seemed better adapted to the practice of politics and the management

line: of plantations, than to government in the province of literature.

line: Southerners wrote easily and gracefully, but without the sincerity and

line: It was when a great emotion had thrilled the heart of the South, and

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: her spirit kindled to a single mighty flame in the prosecution of a

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: cause on which she could unite all her energies, that the artificiality

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: of her literature dropped away, and was replaced by strength of

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: color, truth of outline and power of expression. Before the terror of

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: civil war, the horror of invasion, and the indignity of submission to

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: what she deemed a false interpretation of the Constitution and the

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: principles of Liberty for which her fathers had fought, the literature

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: of the South lost its superficiality, its romantic characteristics.

line: From the earliest days of the war, prose in the form of history,

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: philosophical essays and controversial debate, became the recognized

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: and powerful weapon wielded by her greatest minds: while poetry, in

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: the hands alike of poet and peasant, became the great national organ

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: for emotional expression.

THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: Fully to appreciate the themes and refrains that filled her war verse,

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: it is necessary to understand for just what principles, and with what

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: a temper, the South began the fight. Whatever had been the immediate

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: excuse for war, for the Southerner the conflict very quickly resolved

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: itself into a struggle for liberty. The principle of States’ Rights

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: had always been cherished in the South since the days of the Articles

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: of Confederation, in 1781, which declared at the very onset that

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: while adopting this plan that was designed to make of the various

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: integers a government that might be per se recognizable,--“each state

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: retained its sovereignty, freedom and independence.” “Submission to

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: any encroachment, the least as well as the greatest, on the rights of

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: a state means slavery,” wrote Dr. Basil Gildersleeve.[6] “The extreme

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: Southern States considered this right menaced by the issue of the

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: presidential election.” The South had always clung to the earlier

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: conception of national union of separate and independent units. That

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: the North regarded her as a rebel against the Constitution of her

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: fathers but goaded her the more bitterly, who felt that above all

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: things she battled in the right, for the freedom of which Washington

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: himself had dreamed, and which her own ancestors had been the greater

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: part of the instrument in winning and perfecting. It was therefore to

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: the South a holy contest. “Right or wrong, we were fully persuaded in

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: our own minds, and there was no lurking suspicion of any moral weakness

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: in our cause,” continued Dr. Gildersleeve.[7] “Nothing could be holier

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: than the cause, nothing more imperative than the duty of upholding it.

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: There were those in the South who when they saw the issue of the War,

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: gave up their faith in God, but not their faith in the cause.”

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: With Lincoln’s decision to provision Fort Sumter, on April 1, 1861,

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: and his call for troops, two weeks later, the question of States’

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: Rights was amplified by the addition of two other sentiments which

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: three together formed the lofty inspiration that, in the South lifted

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: the struggle above the commonplaces of civil strife. At once it

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: was dignified into a war in defence of home, of native land, and of

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: liberty. It was therefore with a certain nobility of purpose that the

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: Confederate Army went forth to battle. The North had enlisted on a

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: punitive expedition: the South had engaged in a crusade for her ideals.

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: This was the magic touch that transmuted the comparative dross of her

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: literature to pure gold. “When there flashed upon poetic souls not the

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: political issues that were at stake, but the great human situation

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: of the struggle, they gave voice to the pent up feelings of the new

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: nation.”

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: The poetic genius of the Southerners had always been lyric in

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: character, partly as the result of environment, partly that of racial

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: temper, partly as an inheritance from the old Cavaliers who had been

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: their ancestors. Nor had the lyrists of the South been of slender

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: numbers. Professor Manly’s “Southern Literature” credits the land

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: with over two hundred poets whom he considered worthy of mention.

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: More than fifty of these belong to Virginia alone, and Dr. Painter

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: wrote[8] of their work that “examination ... reveals among a good deal

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: that is commonplace and imitative, many a little gem that ought to be

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: preserved.” Their method was usually Byronic and amorous. They had,

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: it is true, made little or no use of local color or legend, and had

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: given over the narrative and the dramatic for the lyric. Their work,

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: however, was always melodious and of easy numbers. This was their

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: particular characteristic. The second, and indeed the more interesting,

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: was the lack of the professional touch. Before the War, there had been

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: few vocational poets, as there had been few professed _literateurs_.

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: Poetry was the possession of the many, not of a small group of favored

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: ones, and these wrote purely for the pleasure of the art, with so

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: little care for fame or reputation that many of their verses still

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: remain uncollected. When, therefore, the emotion of the conflict was

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: borne upon the South, there were poets to fight her battles--just as

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: there were soldiers in the field,--who were using an accustomed mode,

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: though with unaccustomed sincerity and felicity. Indeed, the number of

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: war poets is one of the amazing phenomena of the time: and as in the

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: North, literature was mainly in their hands. Beyond the line there were

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: Longfellow, Whittier, Lowell, Emerson, Holmes, Boker, Whitman and Mrs.

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: Stowe. In the South, Hayne, Timrod, Ticknor, Simms, John R. Thompson,

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: George Bagby, Dr. Holcombe, Mrs. Preston, Mrs. Charles, and Father Ryan

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: filled roles as lofty, and as surely inspired. There was, however,

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: this difference in their work. The poets of the North lived and wrote

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: in comparative security and remoteness from the field. Their verses

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: were characterized by a virtuous indignation against the rebellion, by

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: appeals for men, anger at constant delay and unnecessary defeat, and

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: deliberate exhortations in the name of the Union.

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: In the South, on the other hand, conditions were quite different. The

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: whole land was a battle field, which every man, woman and child was

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: bound by his principles to defend with his very life, and from which

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: they had pledged themselves to drive the invading hordes. Each soul

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: was personally involved in the conflict, and the poets, instead of

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: looking on the struggle from afar, and distantly applauding it, looked

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: out from the very centres of confusion, calling to their people words

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: of help and cheer and courage. Theirs was not a plea to engage in the

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: conflict. Theirs was the shout of “Come to the battle! Help us or we

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: perish, and with us the sacred fires of true and personal Freedom.” It

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: was the “terrible experience of a mighty conflict,[9] in which the soul

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: of the people was ... brought out through struggles, passion, partings,

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: heroism, love, death, ... all effective in the production of genuine

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: feeling and the development of real character. While the battles were

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: being fought in the homes of the Southerners, their poets sent forth

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: now a stirring martial lyric, now a humorous song or poem recounting

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: the trials and hardships of camp, hospital and prison life ... these

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: becoming ever more and more intermingled with dirges for Jackson, for

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: Albert Sidney Johnston, for Stuart, for Ashby, and finally for the

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: Conquered Banner. In all these there was no trace of artificiality, no

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: sign of the mawkish sentimentality of the old waxflowery, amateurish

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: and sentimental race of Southern writers.... They were surcharged

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: with deep, genuine, sincere feeling. They were instinct with life. In

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: this respect the war poetry laid the foundation of the new Southern

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: literature ... ‘new in strength, new in depth, new in the largest

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: elements of beauty and truth.’”

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: It was a terrible price to pay for a renaissance of art, wrung as

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: it was from the heart of a wounded people. It appeared still more a

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: vain and useless sacrifice because at first the Southern war poetry

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: gave rise to no literary genre. Indirectly, however, in its return to

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: reality, to simplicity of emotion and truth of passion, this war verse

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: was of inestimable value to the rising school of Southern fiction and

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: prose. Nevertheless, the renaissance could not come at once. It was

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: only when the pain and ruin of war had somewhat passed, and the South

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: had begun to recover from the waste which the conflict had wrought on

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: the land, when the bitterness of the struggle had softened with the

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: changing years and generations, and after the new attitude towards life

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: had had time to crystalize into permanency, that one of her younger

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: poets could write of her, with truth:[10]

THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: Lo! from the war cloud, dull and dense,

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: Loyal and chaste and brave and strong

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: Comes forth the South with frankincense,

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: And vital freshness in her song.

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: The weight is fallen from her wings,

Poem Title: THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: To find a purer air she springs

line: Out of the night, into the morn.

line: Contemporary criticism is seldom safely to be trusted, but there

Poem Title: THE HISTORICAL DEVELOPMENT OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: are times when contemporaneous comment is as valuable as it is

Poem Title: THE HISTORICAL DEVELOPMENT OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: enlightening. It is so with this statement by T. C. de Leon--in his

Poem Title: THE HISTORICAL DEVELOPMENT OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: introduction to an anthology of the Southern Civil War verse.[11]

Poem Title: THE HISTORICAL DEVELOPMENT OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: “If poems born of revolution bore no marks of the bitter need that

Poem Title: THE HISTORICAL DEVELOPMENT OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: crushed them from the hearts of their authors, they would have no value

Poem Title: THE HISTORICAL DEVELOPMENT OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: whatever, intrinsic or historical.”

Poem Title: THE HISTORICAL DEVELOPMENT OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
THE HISTORICAL DEVELOPMENT OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: Southern war poetry is worthy of preservation because it is an

Poem Title: THE HISTORICAL DEVELOPMENT OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: expression of vital appeal and of sentiment wrung from the heart of

Poem Title: THE HISTORICAL DEVELOPMENT OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: a people. For the most part, it was written under the stress of the

Poem Title: THE HISTORICAL DEVELOPMENT OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: moment. It was indeed the spontaneous overflow of powerful emotion, but

Poem Title: THE HISTORICAL DEVELOPMENT OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: only occasionally does it take its origin from emotion recollected in

Poem Title: THE HISTORICAL DEVELOPMENT OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: tranquillity. Nevertheless, it speaks the language of men and women,

Poem Title: THE HISTORICAL DEVELOPMENT OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: and in it we may read, as perhaps through no other medium, the true

Poem Title: THE HISTORICAL DEVELOPMENT OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: story of the development of Southern character, of national spirit, and

Poem Title: THE HISTORICAL DEVELOPMENT OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: of definite sectional consciousness.

Poem Title: THE HISTORICAL DEVELOPMENT OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY

Poem Title: THE HISTORICAL DEVELOPMENT OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: (the best of these appearing either during the war or shortly after).

Poem Title: THE HISTORICAL DEVELOPMENT OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY

Poem Title: THE HISTORICAL DEVELOPMENT OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY

Poem Title: THE HISTORICAL DEVELOPMENT OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY

Poem Title: THE HISTORICAL DEVELOPMENT OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY

Poem Title: THE HISTORICAL DEVELOPMENT OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY

Poem Title: THE HISTORICAL DEVELOPMENT OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY

Poem Title: THE HISTORICAL DEVELOPMENT OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: trace. Occasionally, as in the case of K--s “To the Memory of Stonewall

Poem Title: THE HISTORICAL DEVELOPMENT OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY

Poem Title: THE HISTORICAL DEVELOPMENT OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: but of the various sources, less result is obtained from this field

Poem Title: THE HISTORICAL DEVELOPMENT OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY

line: Next to the appearance of the poems in the papers and journals,

Poem Title: THE HISTORICAL DEVELOPMENT OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY

line: The most eventful months of the year 1861 were April and July, for

Poem Title: THE HISTORICAL DEVELOPMENT OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: April inaugurated “the irrepressible conflict,” and July saw the first

Poem Title: THE HISTORICAL DEVELOPMENT OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: great battle of the war, and a complete Confederate victory. On the

Poem Title: THE HISTORICAL DEVELOPMENT OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: first of April, President Lincoln announced his decision to refuse

Poem Title: THE HISTORICAL DEVELOPMENT OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: surrender of Fort Sumter to the Confederates, and added that he would

Poem Title: THE HISTORICAL DEVELOPMENT OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: undertake to provision the garrison imprisoned there immediately. At

Poem Title: THE HISTORICAL DEVELOPMENT OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: once the South was aflame. On the morning of the twelfth of April,

Poem Title: THE HISTORICAL DEVELOPMENT OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: Beauregard, commander of the Southern forces at Charleston, ordered

Poem Title: THE HISTORICAL DEVELOPMENT OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: the shelling of the Fort, which continued through the thirteenth, and

Poem Title: THE HISTORICAL DEVELOPMENT OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: ended with the evacuation of the Fort on the fourteenth. The war had

Poem Title: THE HISTORICAL DEVELOPMENT OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: begun, and though the opening engagement had been without loss to

Poem Title: THE HISTORICAL DEVELOPMENT OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: either side, and had ended in a Confederate victory, a far bloodier and

Poem Title: THE HISTORICAL DEVELOPMENT OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: disastrous conflict was inevitable. To the rejoicing South, however,

Poem Title: THE HISTORICAL DEVELOPMENT OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: there was only the glory of the first decision to consider, and the

Poem Title: THE HISTORICAL DEVELOPMENT OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: poets in their rapture gave utterance to a sheaf of verse, innumerable

Poem Title: THE HISTORICAL DEVELOPMENT OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: ballads about Sumter, affectionate odes to the nation so gloriously

Poem Title: THE HISTORICAL DEVELOPMENT OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: born and baptized by victorious fire, two great national songs, and

Poem Title: THE HISTORICAL DEVELOPMENT OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: frantic appeals to North Carolina, Virginia and Maryland, Tennessee and

Poem Title: THE HISTORICAL DEVELOPMENT OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: Kentucky to join fortunes of the Confederacy.

Poem Title: THE HISTORICAL DEVELOPMENT OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
THE HISTORICAL DEVELOPMENT OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: The first song published in the South after the war began, and

Poem Title: THE HISTORICAL DEVELOPMENT OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: corresponding, in the North, to E. C. Stedman’s “The Twelfth of April”

Poem Title: THE HISTORICAL DEVELOPMENT OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: was, fittingly enough, “God Save the South” by George H. Miles of

Poem Title: THE HISTORICAL DEVELOPMENT OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: Frederick County, Maryland. Sung to music by C. W. A. Ellerbrock, it

Poem Title: THE HISTORICAL DEVELOPMENT OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: was designed to be, and accepted as the national hymn. It did not

Poem Title: THE HISTORICAL DEVELOPMENT OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: however, succeed in becoming a favorite. On the twenty-sixth of the

Poem Title: THE HISTORICAL DEVELOPMENT OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: month, James Rider Randall, inflamed by the circumstances of the

Poem Title: THE HISTORICAL DEVELOPMENT OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: “Baltimore Massacre” on April nineteenth, wrote his “My Maryland,” the

Poem Title: THE HISTORICAL DEVELOPMENT OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: most famous Southern poem produced by the war, and one whose influence

Poem Title: THE HISTORICAL DEVELOPMENT OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: was greater than a hundred battles. Circulated at first by broadsides

Poem Title: THE HISTORICAL DEVELOPMENT OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: it swept through the South like wildfire, and if any force could have

Poem Title: THE HISTORICAL DEVELOPMENT OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: drawn Maryland to the side of the Confederacy, it would have been that

Poem Title: THE HISTORICAL DEVELOPMENT OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: exerted by this poem. Her Union Governor, however, aided by Federal

Poem Title: THE HISTORICAL DEVELOPMENT OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: troops and tactful advice from Washington, succeeded in holding the

Poem Title: THE HISTORICAL DEVELOPMENT OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: State to the Union, although many Marylanders were ardent Southern

Poem Title: THE HISTORICAL DEVELOPMENT OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: sympathizers. Virginia, on the other hand, who, like Maryland, had been

Poem Title: THE HISTORICAL DEVELOPMENT OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: hesitating over her decision, hesitated no longer, after the episode

Poem Title: THE HISTORICAL DEVELOPMENT OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: of Sumter, implying as it did, Federal coercion. On the seventeenth

Poem Title: THE HISTORICAL DEVELOPMENT OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: of April she seceded from the Union. Her “pausing” had long been

Poem Title: THE HISTORICAL DEVELOPMENT OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: considered a shame and a reproach by Southern poets. Now, they burst

Poem Title: THE HISTORICAL DEVELOPMENT OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: forth in delight. “Virginia, Late But Sure!” was the triumphant shout

Poem Title: THE HISTORICAL DEVELOPMENT OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: of Dr. Holcombe, and Virginia’s answer was expressed in poems such as

Poem Title: THE HISTORICAL DEVELOPMENT OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: “Virginia to the Rescue,” “Virginia’s Rallying Call,” or “Virginia’s

Poem Title: THE HISTORICAL DEVELOPMENT OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: Message to the Southern States.”

line: The poetry produced or published in May chiefly concerns the decision

Poem Title: THE HISTORICAL DEVELOPMENT OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: of Virginia, and the assembling of the Southern armies, those “Ordered

Poem Title: THE HISTORICAL DEVELOPMENT OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY

Poem Title: THE HISTORICAL DEVELOPMENT OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY

Poem Title: THE HISTORICAL DEVELOPMENT OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY

Poem Title: THE HISTORICAL DEVELOPMENT OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: and gradually during May and June, flung out her battle line across

Poem Title: THE HISTORICAL DEVELOPMENT OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY

Poem Title: THE HISTORICAL DEVELOPMENT OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: river it stretched through Forts Henry and Donelson to New Orleans. At

Poem Title: THE HISTORICAL DEVELOPMENT OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY

Poem Title: THE HISTORICAL DEVELOPMENT OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: Virginia and Maryland so far into Pennsylvania that Harrisburg was

Poem Title: THE HISTORICAL DEVELOPMENT OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: directly menaced. It was the four years’ uncertain task of the Union

Poem Title: THE HISTORICAL DEVELOPMENT OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: forces to control this line, to break through it, turn it back and

Poem Title: THE HISTORICAL DEVELOPMENT OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: in upon itself, and finally to starve its scattered remnants into

Poem Title: THE HISTORICAL DEVELOPMENT OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY

Poem Title: THE HISTORICAL DEVELOPMENT OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY

line: to faith and labor; then they sang of hope and courage, attempting to

Poem Title: THE HISTORICAL DEVELOPMENT OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY

Poem Title: THE HISTORICAL DEVELOPMENT OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY

Poem Title: THE HISTORICAL DEVELOPMENT OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: North the cry of “On to Richmond” welled and grew fiercer during May,

Poem Title: THE HISTORICAL DEVELOPMENT OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY

Poem Title: THE HISTORICAL DEVELOPMENT OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY

line: It was only natural that the wave of triumphant exultation which had

line: Lyric as had always been the poetic genius of the South, it was but

line: by Alethea Burroughs of Savannah are terrible expressions of this

line: We do accept thee, heavenly Peace!

line: Albeit thou comest in a guise

line: We lift our foreheads from the dust;

line: and for some unknown reason were assigned to Lomar Fontaine. He was at

Poem Title: THE HISTORICAL DEVELOPMENT OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: once showered with praise and eulogy, but it is interesting to note

Poem Title: THE HISTORICAL DEVELOPMENT OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: that in the Editor’s Table of the _Southern Literary Messenger_ for

Poem Title: THE HISTORICAL DEVELOPMENT OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: June, 1863 (p. 375) at the end of verses by Henry C. Alexander “To

Poem Title: THE HISTORICAL DEVELOPMENT OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: Lomar Fontaine, the author of the verses entitled ‘All Quiet Along the

Poem Title: THE HISTORICAL DEVELOPMENT OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: Potomac Tonight,’ and if report be true, one of the unrewarded heroes

Poem Title: THE HISTORICAL DEVELOPMENT OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: of the South” the Editor has subscribed the following discriminating

Poem Title: THE HISTORICAL DEVELOPMENT OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: comment: “It is questionable whether Fontaine wrote the ‘All Quiet

Poem Title: THE HISTORICAL DEVELOPMENT OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: Along the Potomac.’ There was no occasion to incite such a poem. Our

Poem Title: THE HISTORICAL DEVELOPMENT OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: pickets along the Potomac were rarely if ever shot: those of the

Poem Title: THE HISTORICAL DEVELOPMENT OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: Yankees were shot night after night.[23] We have heard that the author

Poem Title: THE HISTORICAL DEVELOPMENT OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: of the lines attributed to Fontaine is an Ohioan. A brave man--a hero,

Poem Title: THE HISTORICAL DEVELOPMENT OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: if you will,--Fontaine has yet to prove that he is a poet.”

Poem Title: THE HISTORICAL DEVELOPMENT OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
THE HISTORICAL DEVELOPMENT OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: One other poem whose origin has been questioned is “The Countersign,”

Poem Title: THE HISTORICAL DEVELOPMENT OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: which, reprinted in the Philadelphia _Press_ in 1861, was declared

Poem Title: THE HISTORICAL DEVELOPMENT OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: to have been written by a private in Company G, Stuart’s Engineer

Poem Title: THE HISTORICAL DEVELOPMENT OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: Regiment, at Camp Lesley, near Washington. F. F. Browne, in _Bugle

Poem Title: THE HISTORICAL DEVELOPMENT OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: Echoes_, cryptically adds: “But it may now be stated positively that it

Poem Title: THE HISTORICAL DEVELOPMENT OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: was written by a Confederate soldier, still living. The third line of

Poem Title: THE HISTORICAL DEVELOPMENT OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: the fifth stanza affords internal evidence of Southern origin.” This

Poem Title: THE HISTORICAL DEVELOPMENT OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: Confederate soldier was Colonel W. W. Fontaine.

Poem Title: THE HISTORICAL DEVELOPMENT OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
THE HISTORICAL DEVELOPMENT OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: Metrical study of the Southern war poetry leads inevitably to the

Poem Title: THE HISTORICAL DEVELOPMENT OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: conclusion that Southern temperament lent itself naturally to rhythmic

Poem Title: THE HISTORICAL DEVELOPMENT OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: expression. The poets of the South, many of them untrained in the

Poem Title: THE HISTORICAL DEVELOPMENT OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: technique of their art, wrote in every metrical arrangement that can be

Poem Title: THE HISTORICAL DEVELOPMENT OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: imagined, from curious irregular unrhymed rhythms to ballad measure,

Poem Title: THE HISTORICAL DEVELOPMENT OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: and to the long and intricate stanzaic forms used by Simms and Timrod.

Poem Title: THE HISTORICAL DEVELOPMENT OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: In nearly every case, except, of course, with the cruder camp songs,

Poem Title: THE HISTORICAL DEVELOPMENT OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: the verses flow felicitously, and the effect is melodious. Even in the

Poem Title: THE HISTORICAL DEVELOPMENT OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: sonnet form[24] although the Southerner did not seem capable of writing

Poem Title: THE HISTORICAL DEVELOPMENT OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: a true sonnet, the rhythm moves with ease and harmony. The verses may

Poem Title: THE HISTORICAL DEVELOPMENT OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: infringe every rule of the sonnet form, but the result is effective.

Poem Title: THE HISTORICAL DEVELOPMENT OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
THE HISTORICAL DEVELOPMENT OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: Such is the achievement of the Southern war verse. It is a wonderfully

Poem Title: THE HISTORICAL DEVELOPMENT OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: effective expression of sentiment, and becomes all the more remarkable

Poem Title: THE HISTORICAL DEVELOPMENT OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: when one considers the conditions under which it was created. It was

Poem Title: THE HISTORICAL DEVELOPMENT OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: written in a land first rich and prosperous, then through four weary

Poem Title: THE HISTORICAL DEVELOPMENT OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: years ravaged and starved into ruin: by soldiers in the field and in

Poem Title: THE HISTORICAL DEVELOPMENT OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: the prisons, and women suffering silently at home. Even the mediums

Poem Title: THE HISTORICAL DEVELOPMENT OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: through which this poetry was published, shared the vicissitudes of the

Poem Title: THE HISTORICAL DEVELOPMENT OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: land, and have been generally destroyed or scattered. Nevertheless the

Poem Title: THE HISTORICAL DEVELOPMENT OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: war poetry of the Confederacy which remains to us today, stands as an

Poem Title: THE HISTORICAL DEVELOPMENT OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: enduring memorial to the inherent nobility of the Southern heart and to

Poem Title: THE HISTORICAL DEVELOPMENT OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: the fidelity of devotion to principle, which has always given the South

Poem Title: THE HISTORICAL DEVELOPMENT OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: the admiration of those who, while they cannot agree with her point of

Poem Title: THE HISTORICAL DEVELOPMENT OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: view, must nevertheless respect her courage and spirit. At the same

Poem Title: THE HISTORICAL DEVELOPMENT OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: time it forms a notable contribution to the literature of our land.

Poem Title: THE HISTORICAL DEVELOPMENT OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: Best of all, this poetry satisfies the function of those “Sentinel

Poem Title: THE HISTORICAL DEVELOPMENT OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: Songs” of which Father A. J. Ryan wrote, on May sixth, 1867:

Poem Title: THE HISTORICAL DEVELOPMENT OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
THE HISTORICAL DEVELOPMENT OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: When sinks the soldier brave

Poem Title: THE HISTORICAL DEVELOPMENT OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: Dead at the feet of Wrong,

Poem Title: THE HISTORICAL DEVELOPMENT OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: The poet sings, and guards his grave

Poem Title: THE HISTORICAL DEVELOPMENT OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: With sentinels of song.

Poem Title: THE HISTORICAL DEVELOPMENT OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
THE HISTORICAL DEVELOPMENT OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
THE HISTORICAL DEVELOPMENT OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
THE HISTORICAL DEVELOPMENT OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: When marble wears away

Poem Title: THE HISTORICAL DEVELOPMENT OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: And monuments are dust,

Poem Title: THE HISTORICAL DEVELOPMENT OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: The Songs that guard our soldiers’ clay

Poem Title: THE HISTORICAL DEVELOPMENT OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
line: Will still fulfill their trust.

Poem Title: THE HISTORICAL DEVELOPMENT OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
THE HISTORICAL DEVELOPMENT OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
THE HISTORICAL DEVELOPMENT OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY
THE HISTORICAL DEVELOPMENT OF THE SOUTHERN WAR POETRY

line: FOOTNOTES:
[1] See _War Poetry of the South_, ed. by W. Gilmore Simms, Preface,
pp. v and vi.
[2] See _An American Anthology_, Introduction, p. xxii.
[3] See _An American Anthology_, Introduction, p. xxii.
[4] Noted in the Editor’s Table of The Southern Literary Messenger for
January, 1862.
[5] See _Biographical and Critical Studies of Southern Authors_, “Irwin
Russell,” p. 97.
[6] See The Creed of the Old South, pp. 24 and 25.
[7] See The Creed of the Old South, p. 38.
[8] See _Southern Prose and Poetry_, p. 15.
[9] See _Biographical and Critical Studies of Southern Authors_, “Irwin
Russell,” pp. 97 and 98.
[10] See “_To the South_,” stanza V, by James Maurice Thompson.
[11] See _South Songs_, p. vii.
[12] See _Photographic History of the Civil War_, vol. 9, pp. 86 and 88.
[13] See _War Poets of the South: Singers on Fire_, S. A. Link, p. 382.
[14] “_Butler’s Proclamation_” by Paul H. Hayne, occasioned by Butler’s
order to the effect: “It is ordered that hereafter when any female
shall by word, gesture or movement insult or show contempt for any
officer or soldier of the United States, _she shall be regarded and
held liable lo be treated as a woman of the town_, plying her vocation.”
[15] See _The Creed of the Old South_, by Basil L. Gildersleeve, p. 13.
[16] See “Shermanized” by L. Virginia French.
[17] “_Prayer for Peace_,” by S. Teackle Wallis of Maryland.
[18] In the present collection, eighty-one poems are definitely
concerned with the immediate circumstances of defeat.
[19] “_Virginia Capta_” by Mrs. Margaret J. Preston.
[20] See _South Songs_, edited by T. C. de Leon, note 11, p. 149.
[21] See _The South in History and Literature_, by Mildred Lewis
Rutherford, p. 254.
[22] See _Three Centuries of Southern Poetry_, by Carl Holliday, p. 112.
[23] This was probably due to the fact that the Southern slopes of the
river were wooded as compared with the rather bare Northern side.
[24] In the present collection there are seventeen sonnets.
REFERENCE BIBLIOGRAPHY
_An American Anthology, 1787-1900._ Selections illustrating the
editor’s critical review of American poetry in the nineteenth
century. Edited by Edmund Clarence Stedman. Boston and New
York: Houghton Mifflin Company. The Riverside Press, Cambridge,
_The Creed of the Old South, 1865-1915._ By Basil L.
Gildersleeve. Baltimore: The Johns Hopkins Press, 1915.
_History of the Civil War, 1861-1865._ By James Ford Rhodes,
LL.D., Litt.D.: with maps. New York: The Macmillan Company,
_The Photographic History of the Civil War_, Vol. IX. Poetry
and Eloquence of the Blue and Gray: edited by Dudley H. Miles,
Ph.D., Columbia, introduction by Dr. W. P. Trent, of Columbia.
Appendix. Songs of the War Days--Soldier Songs and Negro
Spirituals. New York: The Review of Reviews Co., 1911.
_Poets of the South_: A series of Biographical and Critical
Studies with typical poems, annotated by F. U. N. Painter,
A.M., D.D. New York, Cincinnati, Chicago, 1903.
_The South in History and Literature_: A Handbook of Southern
Authors from the Settlement of Jamestown, 1607, to Living
Writers. By Mildred Lewis Rutherford, Athens, Ga. Atlanta: The
Franklin-Turner Co., 1907.
_South Songs: From the Lays of Later Days._ Collected and
Edited by T. C. De Leon. New York: Blelock & Co., No. 19
Beekman Street, 1866.
_The Southern Literary Messenger._ Dr. G. W. Bagby, Editor,
January, 1862. Macfarlane & Fergusson, Proprietors, Richmond,
Va.
_Southern Prose and Poetry_: for Schools. By Edwin Mims and
Bruce R. Payne. Charles Scribner’s Sons: New York, Chicago,
Boston, 1910.
_Southern Writers: Biographical and Critical Sketches_: “Irwin
Russell.” By William Malone Baskerville. September, 1896.
Barber & Smith, Agents, Nashville, Tenn.
_War Poetry of the South._ Edited by William Gilmore Simms,
LL.D. New York: Richardson & Company, 540 Broadway, 1867.
_War Poets of the South: Singers on Fire._ By Samuel Albert
Link. Nashville, Tenn: Barber & Smith, Agents, c. 1898.

line: “Jehovah, mighty arbiter in earth below,

Poem Title: INDEX OF SOUTHERN WAR POEMS OF THE CIVIL WAR
line: Ere morning stars together sang, in heaven supreme,”--

Poem Title: INDEX OF SOUTHERN WAR POEMS OF THE CIVIL WAR
INDEX OF SOUTHERN WAR POEMS OF THE CIVIL WAR
INDEX OF SOUTHERN WAR POEMS OF THE CIVIL WAR
line: _Acrostic_ [_B. F. Butler_]: Baltimore, March 14, 1863. (R. B.
“Brutal by nature--a coward and knave,
Famed for no action, noble or brave”--
_Acrostic in Memory of O. Jennings Wise_: By Miriam. (S. L. M.
Ed. Table, September, ’63.)
“Over his cold brow
Just touched by Time’s soft silver tracery,”--
_Acrostic on Magruder_: By G. B. Milner, Harrisburg, Texas.
(Alsb.)
“Much hast thou suffered, bright Isle of the Wave!
Ah! can anyone succor: can anyone save?”--
_Addition to the Bonnie Blue Flag_: A Tribute to True
Kentuckians. (W. L.)
“And we will add another cheer for our Kentucky State,
Her sons in the most glorious war have proved both brave and great;”--
_Address_: Delivered at the opening of the New Theatre at
Richmond: A Prize Poem, by Henry Timrod. (W. G. S. from
_Southern Illustrated News_.)
“A fairy ring
Drawn in the crimson of a battle plain”--
_Address to the Exchanged Prisoners_: On the 31st of July,
1862, all the prisoners of war in Fort Warren, (about 250
soldiers of the Confederate army) embarked for Fortress Monroe,
to be exchanged. They left in Fort Warren, 14 gentlemen, who
were imprisoned under the designation of “political prisoners.”
These were all Marylanders by birth, all but one (Mr. Winder)
were residents of that state when arrested. On their behalf the
following lines were addressed to their departing friends: By
T. S. Wallis, Fort Warren, July 31, 1862: S. L. M., July and
August, 1862. (E. V. M.)
“The anchors are weighed, and the gates of yon prison
Fall wide, as your ship gives her prow to the foam,”--
_Address to the Women of the Southern Troops_: Air--“Bruce’s
Address:” By Mrs. J. T. H. Cross. (R. R.)
“Southern men, unsheathe the sword,
Inland and along the board;”--
_After the Battle_: By Miss Agnes Leonard. (W. G. S. from the
Chicago _Journal of Commerce_, June, 1863.)
“All day long the sun had wandered,
Through the slowly creeping hours”--
_After the Battle of Bull Run_: July 21, [1861.] (W. L.)
“Sadly and low,
Hear how the fitful breezes blow!”--
_Afraid of a Dead Baby_: By Kentucky. (S. O. S.)
“Keep here, my little baby: rest alone!
Not in thy father’s tomb can’st thou be laid:”--
_Alabama_: (Randolph).
“Over vale and over mountain,
Pealing forth in triumphal song,”--
_The Alabama_: Respectfully dedicated to the Gallant Captain
Semmes, His Officers and Crew and to the Officers and Seamen of
the C. S. Navy: by E. King, author of Naval Songs of the South.
Richmond, Va., George Dunn & Co. (R. B. M., 1864.)
“The wind blow off yon rocky shore
Boys! Set your sails all free”--
_The Alabama Cottage_: A Homely Scene. (R. B. B.)
“The Alabamian sat by the chimney side--
His face was wrinkled and worn.”--
_Albert Sidney Johnston_: (Im.)
“Honor to him who only drew
In Freedom’s cause his battle blade,”--
_Albert Sidney Johnston_: By A. G. (E. V. M., ’69.)
“I heard afar, the cannon’s roar,
Its lightning flashed from shore to shore,”--
_Albert Sidney Johnston_: Killed at Battle of Shiloh, April,
1862. By Fleming James. (E. V. M.)
“’Mid dim and solemn forests, in the dawning chill and gray
Over dank, unrustling leaves, or through the stiff and sodden clay”--
_Albert Sidney Johnston_: Dirge by Colonel A. W. Terrell.
(Alsb.)
“Hush the notes of exultation for a battle dearly won!
Low the chief’s proud form is lying--Texas weeps another son!”--
_All Is Gone_: By Fadette. (W. G. S. from the Memphis Appeal.)
“Sister hark! Atween the trees cometh naught but summer breeze?
All is gone”--
_All Over Now_: (Im.)
“All over now! The trumpet blast,
The hurried tramping to and fro,”--
_All Quiet Along the Potomac Tonight_: By Mrs. Randolph
Harrison. (C. S. B.)
“All quiet along the Potomac tonight,
No sound save the rush of the river”--
_All Spice: Or Spice for All_: By Cola, Le Diable Boiteux.
Baltimore, March 7, 1862: Baltimore, April 1, 1862. (R. B. B.)
“The people endure all
The Hydropaths cure all”--
_All’s Noise Along the Appomattox_: Battle of the Crater, A.
“All’s noise along the Appomattox tonight,
For Grant, with his Whiteworth’s and Parrots”--
_All’s Well_: By Mrs. Margaret J. Preston of Va. (Amaranth,
from _The Land We Love_.)
“‘All’s well!’ How the musical sound
Is pleasantly smiting the ear,”--
_All’s Well: Come to the Rescue._ (R. B. B.)
“One night of late I chanced to stray
Being in the pleasant sweet month of May dream.”--
_Allons Enfants: The Southern Marseillaise_: Air “Marseillaise.”
By A. E. Blackmar, New Orleans, 1861. (C. S. B.)
[“This may be called the rallying song of the Confederacy.
Composed early in 1861, it was sung throughout the South while
the soldiers were hurried to Virginia with this, the grandest
of martial airs, as a benediction.”]
“Sons of the South, awake to glory,
A thousand voices bid you rise”--
_The American Star_: Air “Humors of Glen.” Published by Louis
Bonsai, Baltimore and Frederic Streets, Baltimore. (R. B. B. p.
“Come, striking the bold anthem, the war dogs are howling,
Already they eagerly snuff up their prey”--
_The Angel of the Church_: By W. Gilmore Simms. January, 1864.
“Aye, strike with sacrilegious aim
The temple of the living God;”--
_The Angel of the Hospital_: By S. C. Mercer. (R. N. S. from
the Louisville Journal.)
“’Twas nightfall in the hospital. The day
As though its eyes were dimmed with bloody rain”--
_Another Flag: A Second Thought_: [By C. B. Northrup.]
(Outcast.)
“Whole we preserve the stars and stripes and blue
Of freedom’s ancient flag, it will not do”--
_Another Yankee Doodle_: (R. R.)
“Yankee Doodle has a mind
To whip the Southern traitors.”--
_An Answer to the Poem Entitled “How They Act in Baltimore:”_
By Redgauntlet. (Md. Hist. B.)
“When our ladies on the street
Yankee soldiers chance to meet,”--
_An Appeal_: By Kentucky. (S. O. S.)
“Haste, Kentuckians! wait no longer;
Rally, and you will be stronger.”--
_An Appeal for Jefferson Davis To His Excellency, Andrew
Johnson, President of the United States_: By a Lady of
Virginia. (E. V. M.)
“Unheralded, unknown, I come to thee,
Who holdest in thy hands the scales of power;”--
_An Appeal for Maryland_: By B. Baltimore, January 20, 1862.
“Of all the gems that gild the wreath
Of freedom, the blue sky underneath,”--
_Appeal to Maryland_: From a Dying Soldier at Manassas: by a
Lady of Maryland. (S. L. M., Oct., 1861.)
“Oh Mother! my Maryland! will you awake?
Hear you not from Manassas the thunder of guns?”--
_Appeal to the South_: (R. B. B.)
“Southrons! since we boast that name;
Southrons! since your blood we claim”--
_An Appeal to the South_: By A Daughter of Dixie H. Baltimore,
Jan. 24, 1862; also Norfolk, Va., Jan. 24, 1862. (R. B. B. 2 &
“Hark! o’er the Southern hills I hear
The cannons and the rifles sound;”--
_(The) Approaching Battle Hour_: By Kentucky. Richmond,
Virginia, June, 1862. (S. O. S.)
“Ah! hovers over them
The gaunt war-demon fell;”--
_April 26th_: In the ceremonies at Memphis, Tennessee, 26th
April, “In Memory of the Confederate Dead,” Dr. Ford one of the
speakers improvised the following appropriate lines: (E. V. M.)
“In rank and file, in sad array
As though their watch still keeping,”--
_April Twenty-Sixth_: By Annie Chambers Ketchum. Memphis, Tenn.
“Dreams of a stately land,
Where rose and lotus open to the sun”--
_Are We Free?_ By James R. Brewer. Annapolis, Oct. 22, 1861.
“Are we free? Go ask the question
In the cells of Lafayette,”--
_Are You Ready?_ (Bohemian from the Macon _Telegraph_.)
“Sons and brothers--near and far,
Have you heard the tones of war?”--
_Arise! Ye Sons of Freeborn Sires!_ By A. E. Morris, Company C,
20th Infantry. (Alsb.)
“Arise! ye sons of freeborn sires, arise! your country save!
Kindle again the wonted fires that animate the brave:”--
_Arlington_: By Margaret J. Preston. (E. V. M.)
“You stand upon the chasm’s brink
That yawns so deadly deep,”--
_Arm for The Southern Land_: By General Mirabeau B. Lamar. (S.
B. P.)
“Arm for the Southern land,
All fear of death disdaining;”--
_The Army and Its Flag of Stars and Stripes_: [By C. B.
Northrup] (Outcast.)
“In Liberty’s great war”--
_Arouse, Kentuckians!_ By Kentucky. (S. O. S.)
“Arouse, Kentuckians, or my heart will break!
What though by thousands brethren may forsake”--
_Ashby_: By John R. Thompson of Virginia. Richmond, June 13,
1862: S. L. M., Editor’s Table, May, 1862. (S. S.)
“To the brave all homage render!
Weep, ye skies of June!”--
_The Ashbys_: By D. B. Lucas, of Va. (E. V. M. ’69.)
“And lo! there galloped through the gates of war
Two brothers, riding side by side, with spurs,”--
_Ashby’s Avengers_: Air “Annie Lyle.” (Cav.)
“Down where the Southern army
Near Virginia’s side,”--
_Ashby’s Death_: Air: “Annie Laurie.” (Cav.)
“A wail sweeps o’er the Valley,
Virginia’s deep with woe.”--
_Ashes of Glory_: By A. J. Requier. (W. G. S.)
“Fold up the gorgeous silken sun,
By bleeding martyrs blest,”--
_At Fort Pillow_: By James R. Randall. (W. G. S. from the
Wilmington _Journal_, April 25, 1864.)
“You shudder as you think upon
The carnage of the grim report”--
_At Galveston, Texas_: By H. L. Flash. (Alsb.)
“We parted, love, some months ago, in pleasant summer weather;
You blamed the fates that you and I could not remain together;”--
_Attention!_ By B. Baltimore, Oct. 16, 1861. (R. B. B. 7.)
“Hearken, friends and foes now hearken
See Abe Lincoln’s prospects darken;”--
_Audax Omnia Perpeti_, etc. By B. (R. B. B. 4.)
“Come pretty muse, give me your help,
Keen make my pen as the teamster’s lash”--
_Auld Lang Syne_: A supposed song of Morgan’s Cavalry on
entering a Kentucky town. By Kentucky. (S. O. S.)
“Shall auld acquaintance be forgot,
And not now be brought to mind?”--
_Autumn Thoughts, 1862_: By Miss Mary A. Grason. (E. V. M. ’69.)
“Our Autumn comes with tender glow;
A golden haze is on the hills,”--
_The Autumn Rain_: By Susan Archer Talley. Richmond, Va. (E. V.
“Softly, mournfully, slowly,
Droppeth the rain from the eaves”--
_The Avatar of Hell_: Sonnet, by “Pax.” (W. G. S. from the
Charleston _Mercury_.)
“Six thousand years of commune, God with man,
Two thousand years of Christ, yet from such roots”--
_Awake! Arise!_ By G. W. Archer, M. D. (W. G. S.)
“Sons of the South, awake, arise!
A million foes sweep down amain,”--
_Awake in Dixie_: By H. T. S., Winchester, Va., February 24,
1862. Air, “Dixie’s Land.” (R. B. B. 7.)
“Hear ye not the sound of battle,
Sabres’ clash and muskets’ rattle:”--
_Away with the Dastards Who Whine of Defeat_: By Paul H. Hayne
of S. C. Charleston, May 10, 1862. (E. V. M.)
“Away with the dastards who whine of defeat
And hint that the day of destruction draws near,”--
_Away with the Stripes_: By Kentucky. (S. O. S.)
“Ho! away with the stripes, the despots’ fit flag!
The stars and the stripes are the bully’s great “brag”:”--
_A Ballad for the Young South_: By Joseph Brennan. S. L. M.,
Feb., 1861, from the New Orleans _Crescent_. (S. S.)
“Men of the South! Our foes are up
In fierce and grim array;”--
_The Ballad of the Right_: By J. W. Overall. (S. S. from the
New Orleans _True Delta_.)
“In other days our fathers’ love was loyal, full and free,
For those they left behind them in the Island of the Sea;”--
_A Ballad of the War_: By George Herbert Sass, of Charleston,
S. C. (W. G. S., originally published in _Southern Field and
Fireside_.)
“Watchmen, what of the night?
Through the city’s darkening street”--
_Baltimore_: (West. Res.)
“Hail, queen of cities, birthplace of the just,
Oh how cast down! by Northern vandals crushed,”--
_Baltimore_: By C. (Mr. Samuel’s Scrapbook: Ridgway Library.)
“Hail, queen of cities, birthplace of the just,
Oh how cast down! By Northern vandals crushed,”--
_Baltimore Girls_: Air, “Dearest Mae.” (West Res.)
“O the girls of dear old Baltimore,
So beautiful and fair,”--
_The Band in the Pines: Heard after Pelham died_: by John Esten
Cooke. (W. G. S.)
“Oh, band in the pine-wood, cease!
Cease with your splendid call:”--
_Banks’ Skedaddle_: (Alsb.)
“You know the Federal General Banks,
Who came through Louisiana with his forty thousand Yanks;”--
_Banner Song_: Written and Expressly Dedicated to the Armstrong
Guards. By Wm. H. Holcombe, M. D. (S. L. M., July 1861.)
“See our banner floating high
Stars in freedom’s shining sky;”--
_The Banner-Song_: By James B. Marshall. (R. R.)
“Up, up with the banner, the foe is before us,
His bayonets bristle, his sword is unsheathed,”--
_The Barefooted Boys_: (S. S.)
“By the sword of St. Michael
The old dragon through!”--
_The Bars and Stars_: Air, “Star Spangled Banner:” by A. W.
Haynes. (Randolph.)
“Oh, the tocsin of war still resounds o’er the land,
